prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners and a flat top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.03]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane**. This will be face\\_1 of the prism. 3. **Draw loop\\_1 on face\\_1**. Loop\\_1 consists of the following lines: - Line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] - Line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.45] - Line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.45], End Point = [0.0, 0.45] - Line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.45], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Use a scaling factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch**. Use the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model**. Use an extrude depth of 0.03 (towards the normal) and an extrude depth of 0.0 for the opposite direction. The final dimensions of the part should be approximately 0.75 in length, 0.75 in width, and 0.03 in height. Part 2 Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be set to [0.0151, 0.0219, 0.03]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane**. This will be face\\_1 of the cylindrical object. 3. **Draw loop\\_1 on face\\_1**. Loop\\_1 consists of a circle with the following properties: - Center = [0.09, 0.09] - Radius = 0.09 4. **Draw face\\_2, face\\_3, and face\\_4**. Each face should have a loop that consists of a circle with the following properties: - Face\\_2: Center = [0.1198, 0.3115], Radius = 0.09 - Face\\_3: Center = [0.2638, 0.1845], Radius = 0.09 - Face\\_4: Center = [0.4608, 0.2031], Radius = 0.09 5. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Use a scaling factor of 0.5508. 6. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch**. Use the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 7. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model**. Use an extrude depth of 0.0 (towards the normal) and an extrude depth of 0.024 for the opposite direction. The final dimensions of the part should be approximately 0.55 in length, 0.55 in width, and 0.024 in height. 8. **Cut the cylindrical hole through the entire object**. This will create a cylindrical hole through the center of the object. The hole should be positioned at the center of the part and have a diameter of approximately 0.18 inches.</description>

Extrude the sketch along the normal by 0.625 units with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Use "New Solid" as the boolean operation. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom and a Slope on One Side Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.625, 0.625, 0.25] On the XY plane, create the following lines to form a triangle sketch: * Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0) and ending at (0.375, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting at (0.375, 0.0) and ending at (0.375, 0.5) * Line 3: Starting at (0.375, 0.5) and ending at (0.0, 0.0) Apply a scale to the sketch with a factor of 0.5. Extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of the normal by 0.25 units with no extrusion in the normal direction. Use "Join" as the boolean operation. Final Shape The final shape is a three-dimensional CAD model of a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered shape, with the top and bottom faces being parallel to each other and the sides being perpendicular to the top and bottom. The dimensions of the model are: * Length: ~0.75 units * Width: ~0.63 units * Height: ~0.75 units Note: Due to the nature of the boolean operations and scaling, the final shape may have slightly different dimensions than stated above.</description>
